11+ CEM: fairly straightforward; some hard sections but no surprises. It's music to my ears!
Top Tip 273: remember how much you've learned this year and look forward to showing off your skills and knowledge!
That was two Top Tip 5s! Just GOOD LUCK!! Xxx
Top Tip 5: just do your best and remember that if you get stuck go for the BEST answer. You'll probably be right!
Top Tip 5: if you don't finish a section don't panic. Forget it and focus on the next section. You won't be the only one.
Top Tip 4: timing will be tight. You will not have a single second to look at others or look around the room. Focus at all times.
Top Tip 3: move on if any question is taking too long. Guess and put * by the question so you can return IF you have time (unlikely)
Top tip 2: read the instructions and circle the key words. Look at the example to double check you have understood.

Good luck in the 11+ everyone.
Top tip 1: listen carefully to the instructions and ask if there is any part of them that you can't follow.

TWO WORDS:
As well
All right
In front
A lot

Don't rub out an answer unless you have a better one to put in. The wrong answer is better than no answer at all. #marking maths
'To practiSe; the practiCe.' Think of 'to adviSe; the adviCe,' which have the different 'c' and 's' sounds. #markingenglish
'As well' = two words. All right = two words. Just saying! #markingenglish
CEM+English mock tomorrow. For comprehensions and diagram interpretations GO BACK TO THE SOURCE. The answers are there! Good Luck All!

The past tense of 'to lead' is led. 'She led us home.' Don't get confused with the metal 'lead' and use that. A common mistake!

Editing keeps your spirit in the story and it improves the way you communicate your ideas to the rest of the world. You might change 90%!
To edit, read the work as if it's someone else's. Change bits, scribble over bits, improve bits, cut out bits. A few days later do it again!
The 500 words stories I've read so far are excellent. I can't help much as it's a competition but I would say: EDIT! EDIT! EDIT!

Quick way to divide by 5: divide by 10 then double that. 80 ➗10=8, 8x2=16 ✔️.  175 ➗ 10 = 17.5. Double it = 35. ✔️
Ablution has come up twice this week. Late Middle English: from Latin ablutio(n-), from abluere, from ab- 'away' + luere 'wash'. LATIN I ❤️U

Coordinates: go along the hall first. Once you've found the first number in the hall THEN go up (or down) the stairs!
Equivalent fractions: make sure you change the numerator (top) in the same way that you change the denominator (bottom). Simplify where poss
